page.title: 01ULLAPOOL.
page.content: Village founded by British Fisheries Society in 1788 and planned by David Aitken,advised by Thomas Telford. Population approximately 1000. Well-known tourist centre on shores of Lochbroom giving access to Stornoway,Lewis, via roll-on, roll-off ferry. Situated in N.W.Highlands in an area of natural,scenic beauty with abundant flora and fauna. One of the main fishing ports for mackerel,herring and prawns,supplying visiting foreign factory ships and home markets.There is also salmon farming in Lochbroom. Trout and salmon fishing available in lochs and rivers. Limestone quarry producing high quality magnesium lime. Education provided at High School from Primary 1 up to 6th.year Secondary.
